questions.question: Why is a relay used instead of directly connecting a DC motor to Raspberry Pi GPIO pins?

answers.a: Relays make the motor run faster
answers.b: GPIO pins cannot supply enough current to run the motor directly
answers.c: Relays reduce the voltage requirement for motors
answers.d: Relays convert AC to DC power

questions.question: What type of signal is typically sent from the Raspberry Pi to control a relay module?
In motor control applications, what is the role of the flyback diode in the relay circuit?

answers.a: Prevents reverse current from damaging components
answers.c: Supplies additional voltage to the motor

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using a relay module with a DC motor?

answers.a: Allows isolation between control and power circuits

questions.question: If a 5V relay module is connected to a Raspberry Pi, which GPIO state usually activates the relay?
What happens if a DC motor is connected without a proper relay or driver circuit?

answers.b: Motor may overheat but Raspberry Pi will be safe
answers.c: Raspberry Pi GPIO pins may get damaged due to high current
answers.d: The relay will fail to switch
